model.employee

Class EmployeeJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.BaseJDBC<Employee>
      • model.employee.EmployeeJDBC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommonJDBC<Employee>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CookJDBC, HostessJDBC, ManagerJDBC, ServerJDBC

    public class EmployeeJDBC
extends BaseJDBC<Employee>
implements CommonJDBC<Employee>
    This class implements the CommonJDBC interface, and includes some JDBC database actions specific to Employee
    Author:
    Phillip Witkin

      • update

        public Employee update(Employee updatedEmployee)
        Description copied from interface: CommonJDBC
        Updates a given object's database information with new information. Cannot update an ID.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        update in class BaseJDBC<Employee>
        Parameters:
        updatedEmployee - The updated object data; Can have unchanged fields blank, but must contain an ID to update proper entry.
        Returns:
        The updated object with all of its new data. Returns null if the ID in the updatedEntity parameter has no match.

        public Employee deleteByID(int employeeID)

        employeeID - An integer representing the ID of the object with a matching primary key to be deleted
